name: The QWERTYUIOP Quiz - Part 3 | Alphabetical Words | 10 Questions

questions.text:
What is this four letter QWERTYUIOP word?

A group of three musicians.
questions.explanation:
trio.

	The term trio can be used to describe three musicians or vocalists. It can also describe any group of three working in harmony.

questions.text:
This QWERTYUIOP word has eight letters:

A possession or real estate.
questions.explanation:
property.

	The word property comes from the Latin "proprietas" meaning ownership.

questions.text:
What is this five letter QWERTYUIOP word?

A ring of metal or rope used in pitching game.
questions.explanation:
quoit.

	Point are won at quoits by pitching the quoit onto a stake. The word quoit come from the Latin "culcita" meaning cushion.

questions.text:
This QWERTYUIOP word has six letters:

A continent north of the Mediterranean.
questions.explanation:
Europe.

	Europe is sixth-largest continent and is actually a large peninsula of Eurasia.

questions.text:
What is this four letter QWERTYUIOP word?

Any animal hunted for food.
questions.explanation:
prey.

	Prey comes from the Latin "praeda" meaning booty.

questions.text:
Here is a five letter QWERTYUIOP word: 

A university teacher.
questions.explanation:
tutor.

	Tutor can also be used for a person who gives private instruction. The word comes from the Latin "tutus" meaning to guard.

questions.text:
This is a QWERTYUIOP word of seven letters:

To punish or coerce by inflicting pain.
questions.explanation:
torture.

	The term torture comes from the Latin "tortura" meaning twist.

questions.text:
What is this five letter QWERTYUIOP word?

Twenty-four or twenty-five sheets of paper.
questions.explanation:
Quire.

	Quire is also an archaic form of the word choir. Quire comes from the Latin "quatern" meaning a set of four.

questions.text:
This QWERTYUIOP word has four letters:

The sound of a contented cat.
questions.explanation:
purr.

	The word purr can also be used to describe a mechanical device such as a running car engine.

questions.text:
What is this six letter QWERTYUIOP word?

To walk stealthily on point of feet.
questions.explanation:
tiptoe & tip-toe.

	To be on tiptoe can also mean to be full of eager anticipation.Definitions are referenced from Dictionary.com.
